intro: Myosotis semperflorens, commonly known as the ever-blooming forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces numerous flowers throughout the growing season. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Myosotis semperflorens is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
